instructions.preparation: face high pulley and grasp revolving cable attachment with arm slightly bent. place one foot slightly back and bend over at hip until shoulder is fully flexed (upper arms at sides of head).
instructions.execution: with elbows fixed approximately 30Â°, pull cable attachment down until upper arms are to sides. return attachment overhead. repeat.

data.comments: Fix elbows approximately 30Â° throughout exercise. Also known as Straight Arm Pulldown.

instructions.preparation: sit on bench facing away from cable pulley apparatus. grasp revolving cable attachment over head with overhand grip.
instructions.execution: with elbows fixed with slight bend, pull cable attachment forward and down as far as possible. return cable attachment forward and overhead. repeat.

data.comments: If cable attachment is too high, grasp attachment first, then sit down. Fix elbows approximately 30Â° throughout exercise. Also known as Cable Seated Straight Arm Pulldown.

instructions.preparation: lie upper back perpendicular on bench. flex hips slightly, so hips are slightly lower than torso. grasp revolving barbell cable attachment from behind. pull to position cable attachment over chest. fix elbows with small bend.
instructions.execution: lower cable attachment toward pulley with elbows bent only slightly. lower until shoulders are fully flexed or upper arms are in-line with upper torso. raise cable attachment over head and continue toward lower body until cable becomes very close to head. repeat.

data.comments: Lower body extending off of bench acts as counter balance to resistance and keeps upper back fixed on bench. Avoid hips from raising up significantly. Actual range of motion is dependent upon individual shoulder flexibility. Keep elbows fixed at small bend throughout exercise.

instructions.preparation: place dip belt around waist. kneel close to low pulley or lever and attach hook to dip belt chains. step up and grasp bars with shoulder width underhand grip. lift legs off of steps or floor.
instructions.execution: pull body up until elbow are to sides. lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. repeat.

data.comments: If weight bottoms out at bottom, attach cable on chain links nearer ends of dip belt.

instructions.preparation: place dip belt around waist. kneel as close as possible to low pulley or lever and attach hook to dip belt in front between legs. step up and grasp close grip p arallel bars with hands facing inward. lift legs off of steps or floor.
instructions.execution: pull body up until elbow are to sides. lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. repeat.

data.comments: If weight bottoms out at bottom of movement, attach cable on chain links nearer ends of dip belt.

instructions.preparation: place dip belt around waist. kneel as close as possible to low pulley or lever and attach hook to dip belt in front between legs. step up and grasp parallel bars with hands facing inward. lift legs off of steps or floor.
instructions.execution: pull body up until elbow are to sides. lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. repeat.

data.comments: This particular apparatus could arguably be referred to as lever machine since dip belt attaches to lever arm, although relatively free movement between lever and dip belt offers qualities similar to cable machine. If weight bottoms out at bottom of movement, attach cable on chain links nearer ends of dip belt.

instructions.execution: pull body up until chin is above bar. lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. repeat.

instructions.preparation: grasp stirrups in each hand. lean forward and step back with one foot so stance is staggered. bend forward knee slightly. position hands with underhand or neutral grip.
instructions.execution: pull down left cable attachment to front of shoulder. pull right cable attachment down to front of other shoulder while returning left cable attachment to front of shoulder. repeat movement with both arms in opposite pattern by pulling left cable attachment while returning right pully attachment. continuing by alternating movement pattern between sides.

data.comments: Video shows appartus with stirrups attached to dual pulley.

instructions.preparation: grasp stirrups in each hand. lean forward and step back with one foot so stance is staggered. position hands with underhand or neutral grip.
instructions.execution: pull down one cable attachment to front of shoulder. return until arm and shoulder are fully extended. repeat movement with opposite arm, alternating between sides.

instructions.preparation: stand facing very high pulley. grasp stirrup in one hand and step back so arm is straight. with leg of opposite side as loaded arm, plant forefoot far back on floor. slightly bend knee of forward leg, same direction as foot.
instructions.execution: pull down cable attachment to side of chest and rotate body toward side of pulling arm. return until arm and shoulder is fully extended, allowing shoulder to raise. repeat. continue with opposite arm.

data.comments: In standing position, both spinal rotation and hip rotation contribute to body's rotation. Because rear leg is only supported by forefoot, hip of forward leg is utilized (hip internal rotation / transverse adduction) much greater than hip of rear leg since forward leg offers more secured base of support.

instructions.preparation: grasp stirrups in each hand. lean forward and step back with one foot so stance is staggered. position hands with underhand or neutral grip.
instructions.execution: pull down one cable attachment to front of shoulder. return until arm and shoulder are fully extended. repeat movement with opposite arm, alternating between sides.

instructions.preparation: grab each side of hanging exercise band with both hands. stretch exercise band down and step onto bottom inside of band with one foot. stretch band down further by extending leg straight down. reach up and grasp bars angled inward with underhand shoulder widthÂ grip while keeping banded leg straight.

data.comments: Free foot can be placed to side of other foot (as shown) or on top of foot in band forÂ safety in case band slips from foot. At conclusion of set, stepÂ down with free foot at bottom of exercises. Dismount band by grasping each side of exercise band, stretch exercise band down, and step out. Continuing to hold on to each side of band while allowing band to contract to normal length.

Grasping each side of exercise band from behind and pull down. Transfer body weight onto free leg, bend knee of banded leg, release band from underfoot, and step out. Transfer both sides of taut band to one hand behind body. Turn body to side of hand holding band while permitting band to contract to normal length.

instructions.preparation: stand facing fixed horizontal bar at neck height. grasp bar with underhand grip shoulder width. position feet forward on floor, slightly in front of bar.
instructions.execution: lower body under bar until arms and shoulders are fully extended. if necessary, use minimal assistance of lower body to control descent, allowing knees and hips to bend, keeping flat on floor. pull body up until elbows are to sides, again with minimal assistance from lower body. repeat.

data.comments: If lower body is used for assistance, Hip and Knee Extensors muscles are utilized. Back extensors may be activated minimally as stabilizer through spine.

instructions.preparation: stand facing fixed horizontal bar at neck height. grasp bar with wide overhand grip. position feet forward on floor, slightly in front of bar.
instructions.execution: lower body under bar until arms and shoulders are fully extended. if necessary, use minimal assistance of lower body to control descent, allowing knees and hips to bend, keeping flat on floor. pull body up until chin is just above bar, again with minimal assistance from legs. repeat.

data.comments: If lower body is used for assistance, Hip and Knee Extensors muscles are utilized. Back extensors may be activated minimally as stabilizer through spine. Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide.

instructions.preparation: grasp bar with overhand wide grip. position forefeet on floor just behind low bar or on bench just behind high bar.
instructions.execution: lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. if necessary, use minimal assistance of lower body to control descent allowing knees to bend. pull body up until bar touches back of neck, again with minimal assistance from lower body. repeat.

data.comments: If bar is too low, knees may need to spread apart at bottom of motion (as shown) to achieve full range of motion. Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide. If lower body is used for assistance, Quadriceps are utilized.

instructions.preparation: stand facing suspension handles placed at neck height. grasp handles and position feet forward on floor, slightly in front of handles.
instructions.execution: lower body under handles until arms and shoulders are fully extended. if necessary, use minimal assistance of lower body to control descent, allowing knees and hips to bend, keeping flat on floor. pull body up until chin is just above handles, again with minimal assistance from legs. repeat.

data.comments: If lower body is used for assistance, Hip and Knee Extensors muscles are utilized. Back extensors may be activated minimally as stabilizer through spine. Range of motion will be compromised if handles are too wide apart.

instructions.preparation: grasp high suspension handles.
instructions.execution: pull body up until neck reaches height of hands. lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. repeat.

data.comments: This exercise can be performed on adjustable length gymnastics rings or a dual anchored suspension trainer where the handles can be placed a short distance apart. Performing this exercise on a TRXâ style suspension trainer would require a narrower grip, with the hands closer together.

instructions.preparation: kneel on floor or mat facing stability ball within arm's reach. straighten hips with subtle bend. also straighten arms with slight bend, down in front of body. place fists side by side on upper side of ball closest to hips.
instructions.execution: lean forward and roll ridged arms out over ball. roll forward as far as possible. raise body back up by pulling arms back until kneeling upright in original position. repeat.

data.comments: Try to keep elbows nearly straight throughout exercise. Also known as Stability Ball Kneeling Rollout.

instructions.preparation: kneel on floor or mat. grasp handles on wheel to each side with overhand grip. position wheel near front of knees and lean over wheel with arms extended downward, supporting upper body.
instructions.execution: with arms straight, roll wheel out as far as possible. lower body gently to floor extending arms forward. raise body back up by flexing hips and pulling arms back to original position. return until hips are extended. repeat.

data.comments: Keep elbows straight or nearly straight throughout exercise. Also known as Wheel Kneeling Rollout. Rectus Abdominis and Obliques practically contract isometrically since little waist flexion occurs under resistance. With no waist flexion, Rectus Abdominis and External Oblique act to stabilize pelvis and waist during hip flexion. See target muscle of rollout question. Also see Spot Reduction Myth and Lower Ab Myth.

instructions.preparation: kneel on floor or mat and grasp suspension trainer handles. position body upright with subtle bend through hip. also, straighten arms in front of body with slight bend.
instructions.execution: lean body forward while maintaining small bend in hip. allow arms to bend forward to sides of head. bend over as far as possible. raise body back up by pulling arms back until kneeling upright in original position. repeat.

data.comments: Try to keep elbows nearly straight throughout exercise. Target muscle, Rectus Abdominis practically contracts isometrically since only a small degree of waist flexion occurs under resistance and, with the assistance of the External Oblique, act to stabilize spine. See target muscle of rollout question. Also, see Spot Reduction Myth and Lower Ab Myth.

instructions.preparation: standing distance facing bar approximately lower chest height. grasp bar with both hands. lean body forward so bar is behind/under bar and arms are to sides of head. feet are keep away from bar.
instructions.execution: allow upper body to hang downward while keeping arms to sides of head. hold stretch.

data.comments: Triceps become more involved if shoulders are keep close to wrists.

instructions.preparation: kneel in front of chair on floor or mat. place inside of crossed arms on end of chair and position head between arms.
instructions.execution: lower torso. hold stretch.

data.comments: None.

instructions.preparation: kneel on mat or floor. extend arms well beyond knees and place forearms on floor.
instructions.execution: lower torso as far down as possible and sit back. hold stretch.

data.comments: None.
To intensify stretch, look up or to one side.

instructions.preparation: instruct participant to stand or sit on floor, chair, or bench and place arm overhead. standing behind participant, grasp their wrist and position their forearm behind their head.
instructions.execution: pull participant's wrist toward back of shoulder. lean torso to side, away from direction of arm behind head. hold stretch. repeat with opposite arm.

data.comments: Participant can be asked to lean torso away from side with arm behind head. See PNF Overhead Triceps Stretch for similar exercise which can be performed with this stretch. Also see Overhead Lat Stretch for similar static stretch. Long head of triceps is only stretched if elbow nears complete flexion.

instructions.preparation: put one arm overhead. grasp elbow or wrist overhead with other hand.
instructions.execution: pull elbow toward head and back or pull arm down toward opposite shoulder. lean torso to side, away from direction of arm behind head. hold stretch. repeat with opposite arm.

data.comments: Avoid overstressing neck anteriorly. See Overhead Triceps Stretch for similar exercise which can be performed with this stretch.

instructions.preparation: sit on bench or floor. place one arm down to side on bench or floor, slightly behind for support. put opposite arm overhead.
instructions.execution: lean and reach to side away from raised arm. hold stretch. repeat with opposite arm.

data.comments: Allow shoulder to raise toward side of head for greater stretch.

instructions.preparation: lie supine on mat or floor. position arms parallel to body pointing opposite direction of legs.
instructions.execution: pull arms toward floor and back sides of head. hold stretch.

data.comments: Stretch can also be performed with feet on floor and legs bent if participant is sensitive to spinal hyperextension.

instructions.preparation: stand with feet far apart. place one arm on side of thigh. put opposite arm overhead.
instructions.execution: lean and reach to side away from raised arm. hold stretch. repeat with opposite arm.

data.comments: Allow shoulder to raise toward side of head for greater stretch.

instructions.preparation: standing toward wall. bend over and place palms of hands on wall, approximately shoulder width and waist height.
instructions.execution: lower torso. hold stretch.

data.comments: Alternatively, forearms can be placed on wall, parallel with elbows pointed downward.

instructions.preparation: sit on end of bench and grasp cambered bar from beneath with overhand or mixed grip.
instructions.execution: elevate shoulders as high as possible. lower and repeat.

data.comments: Since this movement becomes more difficult as full shoulder elevation is achieved, height criteria for shoulder elevation may be needed. For example, raising shoulders until slope of shoulders becomes horizontal may be considered adequate depending upon individual body structure and range of motion with lighter weight. Also see ROM Criteria and Shoulder Shrug Errors.

instructions.preparation: stand holding barbell with overhand or mixed grip; shoulder width or slightly wider.
instructions.execution: elevate shoulders as high as possible. lower and repeat.

data.comments: Since this movement becomes more difficult as full shoulder elevation is achieved, height criteria for shoulder elevation may be needed. For example, raising shoulders until slope of shoulders becomes horizontal may be considered adequate depending upon individual body structure and range of motion with lighter weight. Also see ROM Criteria and Shoulder Shrug Errors.

instructions.preparation: step into elevated trap bar stand. bend down and grasp handles of apparatus to sides. stand upright.
instructions.execution: elevate shoulders as high as possible. lower and repeat.

data.comments: Since this movement becomes more difficult as full shoulder elevation is achieved, height criteria for shoulder elevation may be needed. For example, raising shoulders until slope of shoulders becomes horizontal may be considered adequate, depending upon individual body structure and range of motion with lighter weight. Also see ROM Criteria and Shoulder Shrug Errors.

instructions.preparation: step into trap barbell and stand holding handles of trap bar to sides.
instructions.execution: elevate shoulders as high as possible. lower and repeat.

data.comments: Since this movement becomes more difficult as full shoulder elevation is achieved, height criteria for shoulder elevation may be needed. For example, raising shoulders until slope of shoulders becomes horizontal may be considered adequate depending upon individual body structure and range of motion with lighter weight. Also see ROM Criteria and Shoulder Shrug Errors.

instructions.preparation: position adjustable pulleys at low position. stand close to cable bar and grasp with shoulder width or slightly wider overhand grip.
instructions.execution: elevate shoulders as high as possible. lower and repeat.

data.comments: Since this movement becomes more difficult as full shoulder elevation is achieved, height criteria for shoulder elevation may be needed. For example, raising shoulders until slope of shoulders becomes horizontal may be considered adequate, depending upon individual body structure and range of motion with lighter weight. Also see ROM Criteria and Shoulder Shrug Errors.

instructions.preparation: stand between two low pulleys and grasp stirrups to each side. stand upright with arms straight down to each side.
instructions.execution: with arms straight, elevate shoulders as high as possible. lower and repeat.

data.comments: Since this movement becomes more difficult as full shoulder elevation is achieved, height criteria for shoulder elevation may be needed. For example, raising shoulders until slope of shoulders becomes horizontal may be considered adequate depending upon individual body structure and range of motion with lighter weight. Also see ROM Criteria and Shoulder Shrug Errors.

instructions.preparation: stand facing low pulley and grasp cable bar with shoulder width or slightly wider overhand grip. stand close to pulley.
instructions.execution: with arms straight, elevate shoulders as high as possible. lower and repeat.

data.comments: Since this movement becomes more difficult as full shoulder elevation is achieved, height criteria for shoulder elevation may be needed. For example, raising shoulders until slope of shoulders becomes horizontal may be considered adequate depending upon individual body structure and range of motion with lighter weight. Also see ROM Criteria and Shoulder Shrug Errors.

instructions.preparation: grasp stirrup with one hand and stand close to low pulley to side.
instructions.execution: with arms straight, elevate shoulder as high as possible. lower and repeat.

data.comments: Since this movement becomes more difficult as full shoulder elevation is achieved, height criteria for shoulder elevation may be needed. For example, raising shoulders until slope of shoulders becomes horizontal may be considered adequate depending upon individual body structure and range of motion with lighter weight. Also see ROM Criteria and Shoulder Shrug Errors.

instructions.execution: with arms straight, elevate shoulders as high as possible. lower and repeat.

data.comments: Since this movement becomes more difficult as full shoulder elevation is achieved, height criteria for shoulder elevation may be needed. For example, raising shoulders until slope of shoulders becomes horizontal may be considered adequate depending upon individual body structure and range of motion with lighter weight. Also see ROM Criteria and Shoulder Shrug Errors.

instructions.preparation: stand holding dumbbells to sides.
instructions.execution: elevate shoulders as high as possible. lower and repeat.

data.comments: Exercise may be performed standing perfectly upright or very slightly bent over. Since this movement becomes more difficult as full shoulder elevation is achieved, height criteria for shoulder elevation may be needed. For example, raising shoulders until slope of shoulders becomes horizontal may be considered adequate depending upon individual body structure and range of motion with lighter weight. Also see ROM Criteria and Shoulder Shrug Errors.

instructions.preparation: stand with shoulders under padded lever.
instructions.execution: elevate shoulders as high as possible. lower and repeat.

data.comments: If possible, position lever height high enough so weight will not need to be squat up that high, but not so high that weight stack bottoms out during exercise. Since this movement becomes more difficult as full shoulder elevation is achieved, height criteria for shoulder elevation may be needed. For example, raising shoulders until slope of shoulders becomes horizontal may be considered adequate depending upon individual body structure and range of motion with lighter weight. Also see ROM Criteria.

instructions.preparation: sit on bench and grasp lower handles to each side. sit upright.
instructions.execution: elevate shoulders as high as possible. lower and repeat.

data.comments: Since this movement becomes more difficult as full shoulder elevation is achieved, height criteria for shoulder elevation may be needed. For example, raising shoulders until slope of shoulders becomes horizontal may be considered adequate depending upon individual body structure and range of motion with lighter weight. Also see ROM Criteria.

instructions.preparation: stand behind bar mid-thigh height. stand grasping bar with shoulder width or slightly wider overhand grip. disengage bar by rotating bar back and stand upright.
instructions.execution: elevate shoulders as high as possible. lower and repeat.

data.comments: Since this movement becomes more difficult as full shoulder elevation is achieved, height criteria for shoulder elevation may be needed. For example, raising shoulders until slope of shoulders becomes horizontal may be considered adequate depending upon individual body structure and range of motion with lighter weight. Also see ROM Criteria and Shoulder Shrug Errors.

instructions.preparation: stand very near to close lever handles. bend over and grasp handles with each hand. stand upright.
instructions.execution: elevate shoulders as high as possible. lower and repeat.

data.comments: Since this movement becomes more difficult as full shoulder elevation is achieved, height criteria for shoulder elevation may be needed. For example, raising shoulders until slope of shoulders becomes horizontal may be considered adequate depending upon individual body structure and range of motion with lighter weight. Also see ROM Criteria.

instructions.preparation: stand between lever handles to sides. squat down with feet flat on floor and grasp upper handles to sides. stand upright by extending hips and knees to full extension.
instructions.execution: elevate shoulders as high as possible. lower and repeat.

data.comments: Since this movement becomes more difficult as full shoulder elevation is achieved, height criteria for shoulder elevation may be needed. For example, raising shoulders until slope of shoulders becomes horizontal may be considered adequate depending upon individual body structure and range of motion with lighter weight. Also see ROM Criteria and Shoulder Shrug Errors.

instructions.preparation: stand with shoulders under padded lever.
instructions.execution: elevate shoulders as high as possible. lower and repeat.

data.comments: If possible, position lever height high enough so weight will not need to be squat up that high, but not so high that weight stack bottoms out during exercise. Since this movement becomes more difficult as full shoulder elevation is achieved, height criteria for shoulder elevation may be needed. For example, raising shoulders until slope of shoulders becomes horizontal may be considered adequate depending upon individual body structure and range of motion with lighter weight. Also see ROM Criteria.

instructions.preparation: sit on seat and place forearms in padded bars.
instructions.execution: elevate shoulders as high as possible. lower and repeat.

data.comments: Since this movement becomes more difficult as full shoulder elevation is achieved, height criteria for shoulder elevation may be needed. For example, raising shoulders until slope of shoulders becomes horizontal may be considered adequate depending upon individual body structure and range of motion with lighter weight. Also see ROM Criteria.

instructions.preparation: stand holding lever bar with shoulder width overhand or mixed grip.
instructions.execution: elevate shoulders as high as possible. lower and repeat.

data.comments: Since this movement becomes more difficult as full shoulder elevation is achieved, height criteria for shoulder elevation may be needed. For example, raising shoulders until slope of shoulders becomes horizontal may be considered adequate depending upon individual body structure and range of motion with lighter weight. Also see ROM Criteria and Shoulder Shrug Errors.

instructions.preparation: stand with shoulders under padded bar.
instructions.execution: elevate shoulders as high as possible. lower and repeat.

data.comments: If possible, position lever height high enough so weight will not need to be squat up that high, but not so high that weight stack bottoms out during exercise. Since this movement becomes more difficult as full shoulder elevation is achieved, height criteria for shoulder elevation may be needed. For example, raising shoulders until slope of shoulders becomes horizontal may be considered adequate depending upon individual body structure and range of motion with lighter weight. Also see ROM Criteria.

instructions.preparation: stand grasping smith bar with shoulder width or slightly wider overhand grip. disengage bar by rotating bar back.
instructions.execution: elevate shoulders as high as possible. lower and repeat.

data.comments: Since this movement becomes more difficult as full shoulder elevation is achieved, height criteria for shoulder elevation may be needed. For example, raising shoulders until slope of shoulders becomes horizontal may be considered adequate depending upon individual body structure and range of motion with lighter weight. Also see ROM Criteria and Shoulder Shrug Errors.

instructions.preparation: stand between parallel bars. squat down and grasp parallel bars from above. kick legs up inverting and balancing body upside down. legs can be kept bent or straight, positioned vertically.
instructions.execution: raise body up a high as possible by pulling shoulders toward ears. lower body to original position and repeat.

data.comments: Falling from an inverted position or hitting head on structural bar when flipping body may result in very serious injury. Adequate clearance must be allowed for head to clear any obstruction during both inversion and dismount.

instructions.preparation: grasp gymnastics rings, one in each hand. sit on mat between parallel bars. kick legs up inverting and balancing body upside down.
instructions.execution: raise body up a high as possible by pulling shoulders toward ears. lower body to original position and repeat.

data.comments: Falling from an inverted position may result in very serious injury. To decrease potential of injury, position gymnastic rings over well padded surface, only high enough to allow full range of motion.

instructions.preparation: grasp wrist or hand from behind and pull arm to opposite side.
instructions.execution: tilt head away from lowered shoulder by positioning ear toward front of opposite shoulder. hold stretch. repeat to other side.

data.comments: None.

instructions.preparation: sit on chair slightly angled to right. position legs far apart with feet on floor. bend over slightly to grasp back of front right chair leg with left hand.
instructions.execution: pull up on chair leg by position torso more upright while allowing left shoulder to be pulled downward. hold stretch. repeat on opposite side while sitting slightly angled to left.

data.comments: None.

instructions.preparation: stand facing very close to stationary bar. grasp stationary bar with both hands just below chest height.
instructions.execution: lean back allowing body and hips to fall back and shoulders to be pulled forward. hold stretch.

data.comments: None

instructions.preparation: cross both arms and place both hands behind shoulders of opposite arms.
instructions.execution: bring elbows closer together in front of body. raise elbows slightly and hold stretch.

data.comments: None

instructions.preparation: stand with side to elbow height cable pulley. grasp stirrup attachment with far arm. position elbow against side and forearm across belly.
instructions.execution: pull cable attachment away from body as far as possible by externally rotating shoulder. return and repeat. turn around and continue with opposite arm.

data.comments: Maintain elbow against side and fixed elbow position (90Â° angle) throughout exercise. Exercise may be performed seated on chair with pulley lowered to elbow height or seated on floor with low pulley.

instructions.preparation: sit with side to low pulley. grasp dumbbell cable attachment with far arm. position elbow against side and forearm across belly.
instructions.execution: pull cable attachment away from body by externally rotating shoulder. return and repeat. turn around and continue with opposite arm.

data.comments: Maintain elbow against side and fixed elbow position (90Â° angle) throughout exercise. Exercise may be performed standing with medium high pulley.

instructions.preparation: stand facing low to medium height cable pulley. grasp stirrup attachment and position bent elbow shoulder height out to side with forearm in line with cable.
instructions.execution: pull stirrup up and back as far as possible. return by lowering stirrup to original position. repeat. continue with opposite arm.

data.comments: Wrist may be kept straighter throughout movement than what is shown. Also, keep elbow at shoulder height and bent at right angle. Height of cable pulley is dependent upon:

instructions.preparation: lie high up on low incline bench or reverse on decline bench on side with arm pit over leg pad (as demonstrated). position legs lower on bench for support. grasp dumbbell and position elbow against side and forearm across belly.
instructions.execution: lift dumbbell upright above elbow by rotating shoulder. return and repeat. flip body over and continue with opposite arm.

data.comments: Maintain elbow against side and fixed elbow position (90Â° angle) throughout exercise. Position incline as low as possible so dumbbell can still be aligned against gravity.

instructions.preparation: lie on side with legs separated for support. grasp dumbbell and position elbow against side and forearm across belly.
instructions.execution: lift dumbbell by rotating shoulder. return and repeat. flip over and continue with opposite arm.

data.comments: Maintain elbow against side and fixed elbow position (90Â° angle) throughout exercise. Placing towel roll under arm increase infraspinatus and teres minor EMG signal activity compared to no towel roll (Wilk KE 2002), although subsequentÂ study found no significant difference (Reinold MM 2004). Also see Dumbbell Shoulder External Rotation Errors.

instructions.preparation: lie supine on incline bench with legs extended down to each side. grasp dumbbell with one hand and position forearm vertically with upper arm perpendicular to body.
instructions.execution: lift dumbbell forward and upward by externally rotating shoulder. return and repeat. grasp with opposite hand, position bent arm out to side of body,Â and perform with other arm.

data.comments: Maintain fixed 90Â° angle elbow position directly lateral to shoulder throughout exercise. Lower Trapezius acts as stabilizer at lower bench angles whereas Upper Trapezius may act as stabilizer and higher bench angles. Also see Dumbbell Shoulder External Rotation Errors.

instructions.preparation: lie supine on bench with legs either on bench or down to each side. grasp dumbbell with one hand and position forearm vertically with upper arm perpendicular to body.
instructions.execution: lift dumbbell forward and upward by externally rotating shoulder. return and repeat. grasp with opposite hand, position bent arm out to side of body,Â and perform with other arm.

data.comments: Maintain fixed 90Â° angle elbow position directly lateral to shoulder throughout exercise. Also see Dumbbell Shoulder External Rotation Errors.

instructions.preparation: sit on bench. place foot on other side of bench and other foot on floor with knees bent. place upper elbow on knee with dumbbell positioned above knee.
instructions.execution: lower dumbbell downward toward lower leg by rotating shoulder until slight stretch is felt. return and repeat. continue with opposite arm.

data.comments: Throughout movement, keep bent elbow (approximately 90Â°) in front of body, chest or shoulder height.

instructions.preparation: stand or sit with side against chest height platform. with dumbbell in hand, position upper arm horizontally on platform, elbow bent so forearm is upright.
instructions.execution: lower dumbbell forward by rotating shoulder. return and repeat. continue with opposite arm.

data.comments: Throughout movement, keep bent elbow (approximately 90Â°) out to side, shoulder height.

instructions.preparation: stand or sit with dumbbell positioned out to side of head; bend elbow, shoulder height with dumbbell above elbow.
instructions.execution: lower dumbbell forward by rotating shoulder. return and repeat. continue with opposite arm.

data.comments: Throughout movement, keep bent elbow (approximately 90Â°) out to side, shoulder height.

instructions.preparation: lie supine on section of bench nearest pads to each side. position body so shoulders and elbows are aligned to fulcrum on each side. place wrists or back of hands on under upper set of pads to each side.
instructions.execution: pull both lever arms back and down as far as possible to each side of head by simultaneously rotating upper arms. lower lever arms to original position and repeat.

data.comments: Those with shorter forearms whose wrists do not make contact with pad would utilize Wrist Extensors as stabilizer to keep wrists ridged while back of the hands move pads.

instructions.preparation: place elbow on forearm pad and grasp handle with upper arm to side of body and forearm against body.
instructions.execution: pull lever away from body. return and repeat. adjust lever to opposite side and repeat with other arm.

data.comments: Adjust lever and body orientation to achieve full range of motion.

instructions.preparation: lever should be forward with lever handle down. push elbow pad forward with forearm, grasp handle with overhand grip. sit on seat with arm pads and lever to side and position in elbow pad at shoulder height. with opposite hand, grasp seat handle if available, for added stability.
instructions.execution: pull lever handle upward and back as far as possible by rotating upper arm. lower lever to original position. repeat. continue with opposite arm.

data.comments: Exercise can also be performed with seat facing inward at 45Â° but this may limit internal rotation ROM of shoulder and supraspinatus will not assist.

instructions.preparation: grasp pole at one end and position overhead with other end of pole behind opposite arm. grasp other end of pole with hand positioned below elbow. position elbow of lower arm close to height of shoulder.
instructions.execution: pull upper end of pole forward so shoulder is internally rotated. hold stretch. repeat with opposite arm.

data.comments: Before pulling pole forward, attempt to orientateÂ pole as vertical as possible and elbow of lower arm as close to lateral of shoulder as possible.

instructions.preparation: place both hands on waist with thumbs facing forward. bend over so torso is parallel to floor.
instructions.execution: allow elbows to fall downward toward floor. hold stretch .

data.comments: Keep back straight.

instructions.preparation: sit on bench or chair. place both hands on waist with thumbs facing forward. lean over and rest torso on thighs.
instructions.execution: allow elbows to fall downward toward floor. hold stretch.

data.comments: None.

instructions.preparation: lie supine on mat or floor with knees bent approximately 90 degrees. position hand under side of waist, palm down.
instructions.execution: allow legs and hips to fall to side of positioned arm. hold stretch. repeat on opposite side.

data.comments: Lean torso toward positioned arm if stretch is not yet felt.

instructions.preparation: lie down on side on mat or floor. position arm on floor with bent elbow positioned forward on mat and hand above elbow. with other hand, grasp back of wrist.
instructions.execution: keeping elbow bend at a right angle, push forearm downward toward floor. hold stretch. repeat on opposite side.

data.comments: None.

instructions.preparation: lie supineÂ on mat or floor with legs bent and feet on floor. bend elbows 90Âº and position to side of shoulders with back of upper arm on floor.
instructions.execution: keeping elbows bend at a right angles, push forearms downward toward floor and hold stretch.

data.comments: None.

instructions.preparation: lie prone on mat or floor. extend arms out to each side on floor.Â  bend elbows 90Âº and position back of hands to sides of body.
instructions.execution: lower bend arms toward floor and hold stretch.

data.comments: Upper arms will end up perpendicular to torso while forearms will be parallel.

instructions.preparation: grasp suspension handles and position bent elbows to each sides of waist.

data.comments: A very upright position (ie: very light resistance) with one foot positioned back slightly (see 'Easier') is typically required for proper execution. Take care to maintain tension on suspension trainer near top of movement. Dismounting can be achieved by walking backward until body is upright or stepping out at top of movement. This exercise can be performed on TRXâ style suspension trainer or adjustable length gymnastics rings.

instructions.preparation: sit with side to low pulley. grasp cable stirrup with near arm. position elbow against side with elbow bent approximately 90Â°.
instructions.execution: pull cable stirrup toward body by internally rotating shoulder until forearm is across belly. return and repeat. continue with opposite arm.

data.comments: Maintain elbow against side and fixed elbow position throughout exercise. Exercise may be performed standing with medium high / adjustable pulley

instructions.preparation: stand with side to elbow height cable pulley. grasp cable stirrup with near arm. position elbow against side with elbow bent approximately 90Â°.
instructions.execution: pull cable stirrup toward body by internally rotating shoulder until forearm is across belly. return and repeat. continue with opposite arm.

data.comments: Maintain elbow against side and fixed elbow position throughout exercise. Exercise may be performed seated if medium high / adjustable pulley is not availble.

instructions.preparation: hold dumbbell in one hand. lie on bench close to edge on side with dumbbell in hand. position elbow on edge of bench against side of body with elbow bent approximately 90Â°. position legs on bench for support.
instructions.execution: maintaining 90Â° bend in elbow, lower dumbbell away from body until slight stretch is felt in shoulder. lift dumbbell toward body by internally rotating shoulder until forearm is across belly. continue with opposite arm.

data.comments: Maintain elbow's bend and position at edge of bench against side of body throughout exercise. Elbow can be held with opposite hand for additional support.

instructions.preparation: hold dumbbell in one hand. lie on mat with dumbbell in hand. position upper arm on mat close to body. bend elbow approximately 90Â° with dumbbell held upright above elbow.
instructions.execution: maintaining 90Â° bend in elbow, lower dumbbell toward floor until slight stretch is felt in shoulder. lift dumbbell toward body by internally rotating shoulder until forearm is vertical and repeat. continue with opposite arm.

data.comments: Torso can lean back slightly allowing for fuller range of motion at the bottom of movement. In which case, forearm does not need to travel any closer than vertical toward body. Elbow can be held with opposite hand for additional support.

instructions.preparation: hold dumbbell in one hand. lie on bench close to edge on side with dumbbell in hand. position elbow on edge of bench against side of body with elbow bent approximately 90Â°. position legs on bench for support.
instructions.execution: maintaining 90Â° bend in elbow, lower dumbbell away from body until slight stretch is felt in shoulder. lift dumbbell toward body by internally rotating shoulder until forearm is across belly. continue with opposite arm.

data.comments: Maintain elbow's bend and position at edge of bench against side of body throughout exercise. Elbow can be held with opposite hand for additional support.

instructions.preparation: lie supine on section of bench furthest away from pads to each side. position body so shoulders and elbows are aligned to fulcrum on each side. place wrists or hands on under lower set of pads to each side of head.
instructions.execution: pull lever arms upward and toward each side of torso as far as possible by simultaneously rotating upper arms. lower lever arms to original position and repeat.

data.comments: Those with shorter forearms whose wrists do not make contact with pad would utilize Wrist Flexors as stabilizer to keep wrists ridged while hands move pads.

instructions.preparation: place elbow on forearm pad and grasp handle with upper arm to side of body and forearm away from body.
instructions.execution: pull lever toward from body. return and repeat. adjust lever to opposite side and repeat with other arm.

data.comments: Adjust lever and body orientation to achieve full range of motion.

instructions.preparation: primary lever should be positioned back with lever handle resting forward on elbow pad. lift lever handle and sit on seat with arm pads and lever to side. place elbow in elbow pads at shoulder height and grip handle with over hand grip so forearm is orientated upward and back. with opposite hand, grasp seat handle if available, for added stability.
instructions.execution: pull lever handle forward and downward as far as possible by rotating upper arm. allow lever to return to original position. repeat. continue with opposite arm.

data.comments: Turn seat facing inward at 45Â° if external rotation ROM of shoulder is limited. Consequently placing the upper arm in this plane limits internal rotation ROM of shoulder and Supraspinatus will assist slightly in interal rotation.

instructions.preparation: grasp end of pole with one hand. flip pole over upper arm. position bent arm to side of body with other end of pole behind arm. reach across body as far as possible with opposite arm and grasp lower end of pole. position elbow at height of shoulderÂ with pole positioned onÂ back side of upper arm.
instructions.execution: pull lower end of pole forward and upward so shoulder is externally rotated. hold stretch. repeat with opposite arm.

data.comments: Before pulling pole forward and upward, attempt to orientateÂ pole as vertical as possible and elbow of upper arm as close to lateral of shoulder as possible.

instructions.preparation: stand at end of wall or in doorway facing perpendicular to wall. bent elbow and place inside of forearm on surface of wall. position bent elbow just below height of shoulder. place far leg forward and near leg back.
instructions.execution: bent over at hip while bending knees slightly. hold stretch . repeat with opposite arm.

data.comments: Bent knees slightly so stretch is not limited by hamstring flexibility and to keep shoulder from being pushed forward.

instructions.preparation: mount wide dip bar with oblique grip (bar diagonal under palm), arms straight with shoulders above hands. kneel on padded platform, lowering it down slightly so hips are slightly bent.
instructions.execution: lower body by bending arms, allowing elbows to flare out to sides. when slight stretch is felt in chest or shoulders push body up until arms are straight. repeat.

data.comments: See mount and dismount. Some assisted machines require you to standing on bar. Also see Assisted Triceps Dip.

instructions.preparation: mount wide dip bar with oblique grip (bar diagonal under palm), arms straight with shoulders above hands. step down onto assistance lever with hips and knees bent.
instructions.execution: lower body by bending arms, allowing elbows to flare out to sides. when slight stretch is felt in chest or shoulders, push body up until arms are straight. repeat.

data.comments: See mount and dismount. Some assisted machines require you to kneel on platform instead of standing on bar. Also see Assisted Triceps Dip.

instructions.preparation: lie supine on bench. grasp bar with overhand and slightly wider than shoulder width grip. arch back, extend hips, and position feet back flat on floor. dismount barbell from rack over chest. have assistant hold board on center of chest.
instructions.execution: lower weight toward lower chest on to board. press bar upward until arms are extended. repeat.

data.comments: Instead of assistant holding bench board, it can be strapped to torso, as shown. Boards of varying thicknesses (1, 2, or 3) can be used. Board Press develops strength in middle range of motion for Bench Press. Gluteus Maximus, Erector Spinae, Quadriceps, and other muscles may be considered significant stabilizers during actual powerlift.

instructions.preparation: lie supine on floor at base of power rack. place feet on floor with knees bent. grasp bar from rack with overhand and slightly wider than shoulder width grip. dismount barbell from rack over chest.
instructions.execution: lower weight to lower chest until the triceps are completely on the floor. relax momentarily, then press bar upward until arms are extended. repeat.

data.comments: Floor Presses are also said to build explosive strength by breaking eccentric/concentric chain (AKA: stretch-shortening cycle) normally activated at bottom of standard Bench Press.

instructions.preparation: lie supine on bench. grasp bar with overhand and slightly wider than shoulder width grip. arch back, extend hips, and position feet back flat on floor. dismount barbell from rack over chest.
instructions.execution: lower weight to lower chest. press bar upward until arms are extended. repeat.

data.comments: Competitive lifting requires bar to make contact with chest above bottom of the sternum with momentary pause. Gluteus Maximus, Erector Spinae, Quadriceps, and other muscles may be considered significant stabilizers during actual powerlift.

instructions.preparation: lie supine on bench. dismount barbell from rack over upper chest using wide oblique overhand grip.
instructions.execution: lower weight to neck to upper chest. upper arms will be perpendicular to torso. press bar until arms are extended. repeat.

data.comments: Upper arm travels in perpendicular path to torso to minimize anterior deltoid involvement and mimics upper arm positioning of Chest Flies. The oblique grip (hand positioned with palm diagonal on bar) allows elbows to be more easily turned outward to each side. Also see Bench Press Analysis.

instructions.preparation: lie supine on bench. grasp barbell loaded with thick chains from each side, with overhand and slightly wider than shoulder width grip. dismount barbell from rack over chest.
instructions.execution: lower weight to chest. press bar upward until arms are extended. repeat.

data.comments: Chains provide increasing resistance as barbell moves away from floor. Chains can be used during either Powerlift-style Bench Press or Standard-style Bench Press. Also see Bench Press Analysis.

instructions.preparation: lie supine on bench. dismount barbell from rack over upper chest using wide oblique overhand grip.
instructions.execution: lower weight to chest. press bar upward until arms are extended. repeat.

data.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide.

instructions.preparation: lie supine on decline bench with feet under leg brace. dismount barbell from rack over chest using wide oblique overhand grip.
instructions.execution: lower weight to chest. press bar until arms are extended. repeat.

data.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide. Latissimus Dorsi involvement is l ow on Decline Bench Press (Barnett 1995). Also see Bench Press Analysis.

instructions.preparation: step between wide dip bars with dip belt around waist. kneel as close as possible to low pulley and attach cable to dip belt. stand up and mount dip bar with oblique grip (bar diagonal under palm), arms straight with shoulders above hands. keep hips and knees bent.
instructions.execution: lower body by bending arms, allowing elbows to flare out to sides. when slight stretch is felt in chest or shoulders, push body up until arms are straight and repeat.

data.comments: The animation depicts dip bar placed in front of low pull cable. If cable dip machine is available, attach hip harness and step up to dip bar. Also see Cable Triceps Dip.

instructions.preparation: grasp two opposing high pulley dumbbell attachments. lie supine on decline bench, in middle and perpendicular to both pulleys. slightly bend elbows and internally rotate shoulders so elbows are back.
instructions.execution: bring cable stirrups together above upper abdomen in hugging motion; elbows in fixed position and shoulders internally rotated so elbows are to sides. return to starting position until chest is slightly stretched. repeat.

data.comments: Since incline of bench does not actually affect angle of pull as with dumbbells, similar effect can be achieved on flat bench if cable stirrups are brought together above upper abdomen instead of chest. Keep shoulders internally rotated so elbows point downward at bottom position and outward at top position. Keep elbows at fixed angle, only slightly bent. Anterior Deltoid will no longer act as synergist in steep decline bench position.

instructions.preparation: grasp two opposing low pulley stirrup attachments. lie supine on bench, in middle and perpendicular to both pulleys. slightly bend elbows and internally rotate shoulders so elbows are back.
instructions.execution: bring cable attachments together in hugging motion with elbows in fixed position and shoulders internally rotated so elbows are to sides. return to starting position until slight stretch. repeat.

data.comments: Keep shoulders internally rotated so elbows point downward at bottom position and outward at top position. Keep elbows at fixed angle, only slightly bent.

instructions.preparation: sit on seat and grasp stirrups to each side. slightly bend elbows and internally rotate shoulders so elbows are back.
instructions.execution: keeping elbows pointed high, bring cable attachments together in hugging motion with elbows in fixed position. return to starting position until slight stretch. repeat.

data.comments: Shoulders are kept internally rotated so elbows are pointing back and out to sides.

instructions.preparation: grasp two opposing high pulley dumbbell attachments. stand with pulleys to each side. bend over slightly by flexing hips and knees. bend elbows slightly and internally rotate shoulders so elbows are back initially.
instructions.execution: bring cable attachments together in hugging motion with elbows in fixed position. keep shoulders internally rotated so elbows are pointed upward at top and out to sides at bottom. return to starting position until chest muscles are stretched. repeat.

data.comments: Under greater resistance, positioning torso at lower angle downward (by bending over at hips), will allow upper body weight to counterbalance upward pull of cables, as opposed to stepping forward and struggling with backward pull of cables.

instructions.preparation: grasp two opposing high pulley dumbbell attachments. lie supine on decline bench, in middle and perpendicular to both pulleys. slightly bend elbows and internally rotate shoulders so elbows are back.
instructions.execution: bring cable stirrups together above upper abdomen in hugging motion; elbows in fixed position and shoulders internally rotated so elbows are to sides. return to starting position until chest is slightly stretched. repeat.

data.comments: Since incline of bench does not actually affect angle of pull as with dumbbells, similar effect can be achieved on flat bench if cable stirrups are brought together above upper abdomen instead of chest. Keep shoulders internally rotated so elbows point downward at bottom position and outward at top position. Keep elbows at fixed angle, only slightly bent. Anterior Deltoid will no longer act as synergist in steep decline bench position.

instructions.preparation: position adjustable pulley higher than intended height but within arms reach from bench. position bench under cable bar. lie supine on bench. while lying on bench, reach over and lower each pulley into intended position so that cables are taut in lowest position with bar on chest. grasp bar with both hands using wide oblique overhand grip.
instructions.execution: press bar upward until arms are extended. lower bar to chest or until slight stretch is felt in shoulders. repeat.

data.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide. Also see Bench Press Analysis and Cable Bar Standing Bench Press.

instructions.preparation: lie on bench and grasp stirrups attached to low cable pulley on each side. position stirrups out to each side of chest with bent arm under each wrist.
instructions.execution: push stirrups up over each shoulder until arms are straight and parallel to one another. return stirrups to original position, until slight stretch is felt in shoulders or chest. repeat.

data.comments: Stirrup should follow slight arch pattern, above upper arm between elbow and chest at bottom, traveling inward over each shoulder at t op. Also see Bench Press Analysis.

instructions.preparation: sit on seat and grasp stirrup to one side. position elbows out to side, slightly lower than shoulder height. position hand slightly narrower than elbow width in front of upper arm.
instructions.execution: push stirrups out straight in front of shoulder until arm is straight. return stirrups to original position until slight stretch is felt through shoulder or chest. repeat.

data.comments: Also see exercise performed with twisting movement. Pectoralis Minor and Serratus Anterior act as stabilizers if torso is not against back support as shown.

instructions.preparation: stand facing behind cable bar, mounted on each side to shoulder height narrow double pulley cables. grasp cable bar with wide overhand grip. position bar chest height with elbows angled behind. lean and step forward with one foot in front, bending forward leg.
instructions.execution: push cable bar forward until arms are straight. return cable bar to original position until slight stretch is felt in chest or shoulders. repeat.

data.comments: Cable pulleys should be relatively close together, narrower than width of arms extended out to sides (but not too close), closer than what is typically found on standard cable cross over setup. Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide.

instructions.preparation: stand between two shoulder height pulleys, facing away from cable columns. grasp cable stirrups from each side. position stirrups to sides of chest with elbows out to sides. position forearms horizontally and parallel with hands elbow width. step forward in lunging posture (one foot in front and other foot behind). lean and step forward with one foot in front, bending forward leg.
instructions.execution: push stirrups forward until arms are straight and parallel to one another. return stirrups to original position until slight stretch is felt in chest or shoulders. repeat.

data.comments: Stirrup should follow slight arch pattern as hands travel closer together toward extension. Cable pulleys should be relatively close together, narrower than width of arms extended out to sides (but not too close), closer than what is typically found on standard cable cross over setup.

instructions.preparation: sit on seat and grasp stirrup to one side. position elbow out to side, slightly lower than shoulder height. position hand slightly narrower than elbow width, in front of upper arm. lean forward in seat.
instructions.execution: push stirrup out in front of upper chest while turning torso away from pulley. return stirrup and torso back to original position allowing torso to rotate back until slight stretch is felt through chest, shoulder or waist. repeat.

data.comments: The effective range of motion of Pectoralis Major is only about half of what it is in non-twisting movement.

instructions.preparation: sit on seat and grasp stirrups to each side. position elbows out to sides, slightly lower than shoulder height. position hands slightly narrower than elbow width in front of upper arms.
instructions.execution: push stirrups out straight until arms are straight and parallel to one another. return stirrups to original position, until slight stretch is felt in shoulders or chest. repeat.

data.comments: Stirrup should follow slight arch pattern, in front of upper arm between elbow and chest in stretched position, traveling inward in front of each shoulder at extended position.

instructions.preparation: stand facing behind cable bar mounted on each side to shoulder height narrow double pulley cables. grasp cable bar with wide overhand grip. position bar chest height with elbows angled behind and above. lean and step forward with one foot in front, bending forward knee.
instructions.execution: push cable bar forward and downward until bar is about hip height and arms are straight. return cable bar to original position until slight stretch is felt in chest or shoulders. repeat.

data.comments: Cable pulleys should be relatively close together, narrower than width of arms extended out to sides (but not too close), closer than what is typically found on standard cable cross over setup.

instructions.preparation: stand between two high pulleys, facing away from cable columns. grasp cable stirrups from each side. position stirrups down to sides of lower chest with elbows high out to sides. angle forearms downward with hands elbow width or slightly narrower. lean and step forward with forward leg bent or stand feet side by side with both legs slightly bent (as shown).
instructions.execution: push stirrups at forward/downward angle until arms are straight and parallel to one another. return stirrups to original position until slight stretch is felt in chest or shoulders. repeat.

data.comments: Stirrup should follow slight arch pattern as hands travel closer together toward extension. Cable pulleys should be relatively close together, narrower than width of arms extended out to sides (but not too close), closer than what is typically found on standard cable cross over setup.

instructions.preparation: sit on seat and grasp stirrups to each side. position elbows out to sides, slightly lower than shoulder height. position hands slightly narrower than elbow width in front of upper arms.
instructions.execution: push stirrups forward and slightly downward until arms are straight and parallel to one another. return stirrups to original position, until slight stretch is felt in shoulders or chest. repeat.

data.comments: Stirrup should follow slight arch pattern, in front of upper arm between elbow and chest in stretched position, traveling inward and slightly downward just below each shoulder at ex tended position. Latissimus Dorsi involvement is low on Decline Bench Press (Barnett 1995).

instructions.preparation: grasp cable stirrup from chest height pulley. turn body away from pulley. position elbow of loaded arm out to side, lower chest height. position loaded hand back approximately shoulder height and elbow width. step far forward with foot of opposite side of loaded arm. bend knees and position heel off rear foot off floor.
instructions.execution: push stirrups away from body, horizontally until arm is straight and inline with cable. return stirrups to original position until slight stretch is felt in chest or shoulder. repeat. continue with opposite arm.

data.comments: Stirrup should follow slight arch pattern, in front of upper arm between elbow and chest in stretched position, traveling inward in front shoulder at contracted position.

instructions.preparation: lie on bench and grasp stirrups attached to low cable pulley on each side. position stirrups out to each side of chest with bent arm under each wrist.
instructions.execution: push stirrups up over each shoulder until arms are straight and parallel to one another. return stirrups to original position, until slight stretch is felt in shoulders or chest. repeat.

data.comments: Stirrup should follow slight arch pattern, above upper arm between elbow and chest at bottom, traveling inward over each shoulder at t op. Also see Bench Press Analysis.

instructions.preparation: sit down on bench with dumbbells resting on lower thigh. kick weights to shoulder and lie back. position dumbbells to sides of chest with bent arm under each dumbbell.
instructions.execution: press dumbbells up with elbows to sides until arms are extended. lower weight to sides of chest until slight stretch is felt in chest or shoulder. repeat.

data.comments: Dumbbells should follow slight arch pattern, above upper arm between elbow and chest at bottom, traveling inward over each shoulder at top. No need to drop weights - see suggested mount and dismount techniques: standard or advanced. Also see mount & dismount from special machine rack and Bench Press Analysis.

instructions.preparation: sit down on decline bench with feet under leg brace and dumbbells resting on thigh. lie back with dumbbells. position dumbbells to sides of chest with bent arm under each dumbbell.
instructions.execution: press dumbbells up with elbows to sides until arms are extended. lower weight to sides of chest until slight stretch is felt in chest or shoulder. repeat.

data.comments: Stirrup should follow slight arch pattern, above upper arm between elbow and chest at bottom, traveling inward over each shoulder at top. No need to drop weights - see suggested mount and dismount technique. Latissimus Dorsi involv ement is low on Decline Bench Press (Barnett 1995). Also see mount & dismount from special machine rack and Bench Press Analysis.

instructions.preparation: grasp two dumbbells. lie supine on decline bench. support dumbbells above upper abdomen with arms fixed in slightly bent position. internally rotate shoulders so elbows are to sides.
instructions.execution: lower dumbbells to sides until chest muscles are stretched with elbows fixed. bring dumbbells together in wide hugging motion until dumbbells are nearly together. repeat.

data.comments: Keep elbows at fixed angle, only slightly bent, and pointing outward, opposite direction of upward motion. Anterior Deltoid will no longer act as synergist in steep decline bench position.

instructions.preparation: grasp two dumbbells. lie supine on bench. support dumbbells above chest with arms fixed in slightly bent position. internally rotate shoulders so elbows point out to sides.
instructions.execution: lower dumbbells to sides until chest muscles are stretched with elbows fixed in slightly bent position. bring dumbbells together in wide hugging motion until dumbbells are nearly together. repeat.

data.comments: Keep shoulders internally rotated so elbows point downward at bottom position and outward at top position. Keep elbows at fixed angle, only slightly bent.

instructions.preparation: sit on lower pad with back against upper pad, facing dumbbell in rack. position feet under padded bars. grasp dumbbell by handle with both hands. pull top of dumbbell to chest. push dumbbell up over chest with both hands under inner plate of dumbbell. raise hips up from pad and recline torso back so chest faces upward. keep hips and elbows slightly bent.
instructions.execution: keeping elbows slightly bent throughout movement, lower dumbbell over and beyond head until upper arms are in-line with torso. pull dumbbell up and over chest. repeat.

data.comments: Avoid hips from raising up significantly. Actual range of motion is dependent upon individual shoulder flexibility. Keep elbows fixed at small bend throughout exercise. See suggested mount & dismount.

instructions.preparation: sit on seat of arched bench with dumbbell on lower thigh. kick dumbbell up to shoulder while lying back on bench. grasp both hands under inner plate of dumbbell. position dumbbell over chest with elbows slightly bent.
instructions.execution: keeping elbows slightly bent throughout movement, lower dumbbell over and beyond head until upper arms are in-line with torso. pull dumbbell up and over chest. repeat.

data.comments: Actual range of motion is dependent upon individual shoulder flexibility. Keep elbows fixed at small bend throughout exercise. See suggested mount & dismount.

instructions.preparation: lie on upper back perpendicular to bench. flex hips slightly. grasp one dumbbell from behind or from side with both hands under inner plate of dumbbell. position dumbbell over chest with elbows slightly bent.
instructions.execution: keeping elbows slightly bent throughout movement, lower dumbbell over and beyond head until upper arms are in-line with torso. pull dumbbell up and over chest. repeat.

data.comments: Lower body extending off of bench acts as counter balance to resistance and keeps upper back fixed on bench. Avoid hips from raising up significantly. Actual range of motion is dependent upon individual shoulder flexibility. Keep elbows fixed at small bend throughout exercise. See suggested mount & dismount.

instructions.preparation: lie supine on bench with upper chest under bar. grasp bar with wide oblique overhand grip. disengage bar by rotating bar.
instructions.execution: lower weight to chest. press bar until arms are extended. repeat.

data.comments: Orientation relative to lever will depend upon height of fulcrum relative to bench. Position body so bar is over shoulders during extension, yet lower on chest in lowest position. Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide. Also see Bench Press Analysis.

instructions.preparation: lie supine on bench with chest under lever bar. grasp lever bar with wide oblique overhand grip.
instructions.execution: press bar until arms are extended. lower weight to upper chest. repeat.

data.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide. Also see Bench Press Analysis.

instructions.preparation: sit on seat and grasp handles with oblique grip. if possible, place handles in wide position. lean forward slightly.
instructions.execution: push lever down with elbows away from body. return until chest is slightly stretched. repeat.

data.comments: Also see Lever Triceps Dip.

instructions.preparation: sit on seat with chest approximately height of handles. grasp handles with wide overhand grip; elbows out to sides just below shoulders.
instructions.execution: press levers until arms are extended. return weight until chest muscles are slightly stretched. repeat.

data.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide. Also see Bench Press Analysis.

instructions.preparation: sit on seat with lever grips lower chest height. grasp grips with wide overhand grip; elbows out to sides just below shoulders.
instructions.execution: press lever until arms are extended. return weight until chest muscles are slightly stretched. repeat.

data.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide. Latissimus Dorsi involvement is low on Decline Bench Press (Barnett 1995). Also see exercises performed on Hammer Machine. Also see Bench Press Analysis.

instructions.preparation: sit on seat with handles lower chest height. grasp handle with wide overhand grip; elbows out to sides just below shoulders.
instructions.execution: press lever until arms are extended. return weight until chest muscles are slightly stretched. repeat.

data.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide. Latissimus Dorsi involvem ent is low on Decline Bench Press (Barnett 1995). Also see exercises performed on alternative machine. Also see Bench Press Analysis.

instructions.preparation: sit on seat with chest approximately height of handles. grasp handles with wide overhand grip and elbows out to sides.
instructions.execution: press lever until arms are extended. return weight until chest muscles are slightly stretched. repeat.

data.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide. Also see Bench Press Analysis.

instructions.preparation: if possible, place handles in wide position. sit on seat with legs under pads. grasp handles with oblique grip. lean slightly forward and allow elbows to flare out.
instructions.execution: push lever down by straightening arms. return lever up with elbows flaring out until chest is slightly stretched. repeat.

data.comments: See alternative machine. Also see Lever Chest Dip on machine facing away from fulcrum and Lever Triceps Dip.

instructions.preparation: if possible, place handles in wide position. sit on seat and grasp handles with oblique grip. lean forward slightly and allow elbows to flare out.
instructions.execution: push lever down by straightening arms. return lever up with elbows flaring out until chest is slightly stretched. repeat.

data.comments: See Lever Chest Dip on machine facing fulcrum. Also see Lever Triceps Dip.

instructions.preparation: stand on platform in front of lever iron cross machine. grasp handles to each side. bend over at hips with knees and elbows bent slightly. internally rotate shoulders so elbows are pointing upward.
instructions.execution: bring lever handles together in hugging motion with elbows in fixed position. keep shoulders internally rotated so elbows are pointed upward at top and out to sides at bottom. return to starting position until chest muscles are stretched. repeat.

data.comments: Height of platform should allow shoulders to be near the same height of fulcrums. Secondary levers compensate somewhat for variations if alignment between points of rotation (lever fulcrum and shoulder girdle articulation). Under greater resistance, height of platform can be increased so torso can be positioned at lower angle downward (by bending over at hips). This will allow upper body weight to counterbalance upward pull of levers. See Lever Seated Iron Cross Fly and Lever Iron Cross for Lats.

instructions.preparation: sit on seat with back against seat. position both arms over back of padded levers. slightly bend elbows and internally rotate shoulders, wrists are slightly lower than elbows.
instructions.execution: bring padded levers together by pushing pads forward and downward in hugging motion. return to starting position until chests muscle are stretched. repeat.

data.comments: Shoulders should be internally rotated so elbows are pointing back at beginning of motion and outward at end of motion.

instructions.preparation: lie supine on bench. position both arms under padded levers. slightly bend elbows and internally rotate shoulders so elbows are back.
instructions.execution: bring padded levers upward and together in hugging motion. return to starting position until chest muscles are stretched. repeat.

data.comments: Shoulders should be internally rotated so elbows are pointing downward at bottom of motion and outward at top of motion.

instructions.preparation: sit on machine with back on pad. if available, push foot lever until padded lever moves forward. place forearms on padded lever. position upper arms approximately parallel. release foot lever.
instructions.execution: push levers together. return until chest muscles are stretched. repeat.

data.comments: None.

instructions.preparation: sit on machine with back on pad. if available, push foot lever until padded lever moves forward. place forearms on padded lever. position upper arms approximately parallel. release foot lever.
instructions.execution: push levers together. return until chest muscles are stretched. repeat.

data.comments: None

instructions.preparation: sit on machine with back on pad. grasp handles to both sides, shoulder height. slightly bend elbows and internally rotate shoulders so elbows are back.
instructions.execution: keeping elbows pointed high, push lever handles forward and together. return to back toward original position until mild stretch is felt in chest or shoulder. repeat.

data.comments: Shoulders are kept internally rotated so elbows are pointing out to sides. Adjust lever arms on machine so slight stretch is felt when weight is lowered. Also see exercises on alternative machine.

instructions.preparation: sit on seat with back against pad and feet on foot bar. position both arms behind padded levers. slightly bend elbows and internally rotate shoulders so elbows are pointed back.
instructions.execution: bring padded levers forward and together in hugging motion. return to starting position until stretch in chests or shoulder is felt. repeat.

data.comments: Shoulders should be internally rotated so elbows are pointing backward at beginning of motion and forward at completion of motion.

instructions.preparation: sit on machine with back on pad. grasp handles to both sides, shoulder height. slightly bend elbows and internally rotate shoulders so elbows are back.
instructions.execution: keeping elbows pointed high, push lever handles forward and together. return to back toward original position until mild stretch is felt in chest or shoulder. repeat.

data.comments: Shoulders are kept internally rotated so elbows are pointing out to sides. The starting position of levers can be adjusted on many apparatuses, allowing for both rear delt and chest to be exercised. Exercise can be performed on Lever Rear Delt machine even if levers do not adjust to wide starting position. Also see exercises on alternative machine.

instructions.preparation: straddle seat with both levers positioned slightly above horizontal. grasp both lever ends with elbows slightly above levers. sit down near end of seat with torso leaning forward slightly and slightly bent elbows pointing back.
instructions.execution: push levers downward and together in hugging motion. keep shoulders internally rotated so elbows are pointed slightly upward at top and out to sides at bottom. return to starting position until chest muscles are stretched. repeat.

data.comments: Under greater resistance, positioning torso at lower angle downward (by bending over at hips), will allow upper body weight to counterbalance upward pull of cables, as opposed to stepping forward and struggling with the backward pull of cables. Also see Bent-over Fly on Standing Iron Cross Machine.

instructions.preparation: stand on platform in front of lever iron cross machine. grasp handles to each side. bend over at hips with knees and elbows bent slightly. internally rotate shoulders so elbows are pointing upward.
instructions.execution: bring lever handles together in hugging motion with elbows in fixed position. keep shoulders internally rotated so elbows are pointed upward at top and out to sides at bottom. return to starting position until chest muscles are stretched. repeat.

data.comments: Height of platform should allow shoulders to be near the same height of fulcrums. Secondary levers compensate somewhat for variations if alignment between points of rotation (lever fulcrum and shoulder girdle articulation). Under greater resistance, height of platform can be increased so torso can be positioned at lower angle downward (by bending over at hips). This will allow upper body weight to counterbalance upward pull of levers. See Lever Seated Iron Cross Fly and Lever Iron Cross for Lats.

instructions.preparation: lie supine on bench with chest under lever bar. grasp lever bar with wide oblique overhand grip.
instructions.execution: press bar until arms are extended. lower weight to upp er chest. repeat.

data.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide. Also see Bench Press Analysis.

instructions.preparation: sit on seat with lever grips lower chest height. grasp grips with wide overhand grip; elbows out to sides just below shoulders.
instructions.execution: press one lever until arm is extended. return lever back until chest muscle is slightly stretched. repeat with opposite arm, alternating between sides.

data.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide.

instructions.preparation: sit on seat with chest approximately height of horizontal handles. if available, push foot lever until lever is within grasping range. grasp handles with wide overhand grip; elbows out to sides just below shoulders. release foot lever.
instructions.execution: press lever until arms are extended. return weight until chest muscles are slightly stretched. repeat.

data.comments: Some machines have foot levers to position handles in a more comfortable starting and ending position. If foot lever is available, engage it before grasping handles, release it before performing exercise, and engage it again just before releasing grips.

instructions.preparation: sit on seat with sides of ribs approximately height of parallel handles. if available, push foot lever until handles are within grasping range. grasp parallel handles. release foot lever.
instructions.execution: press lever until arms are extended. return weight until shoulders or chest feels slightly stretched. repeat.

data.comments: Some machines have foot levers to position handles in a more comfortable starting and ending position. If foot lever is available, engage it before grasping handles, release it before performing exercise, and engage it again just before releasing grips.
